intro: Orthosiphon allenii, commonly known as the Java hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically has heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types. Orthosiphon allenii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
